block.p: Meredith Ann Halpern, the daughter of Adrienne N. Halpern of Englewood Cliffs, N.J., and the late George Halpern, is to be married in Brooklyn today to David H. Must, the son of Eleanor and Raymond Must of Dayton, Ohio. Rabbi Shira Stern, a cousin of the bride, is to perform the ceremony at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

Ms. Halpern is keeping her name. She is the deputy press secretary to Mayor Frank Jordan of San Francisco. She graduated from Swarthmore College and received an M.B.A. from New York University. Her father was a professor emeritus and the chairman of the art department at the City University of New York.

Meredith Ann Halpern, the daughter of Adrienne N. Halpern of Englewood Cliffs, N.J., and the late George Halpern, is to be married in Brooklyn today to David H. Must, the son of Eleanor and Raymond Must of Dayton, Ohio. Rabbi Shira Stern, a cousin of the bride, is to perform the ceremony at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

Ms. Halpern is keeping her name. She is the deputy press secretary to Mayor Frank Jordan of San Francisco. She graduated from Swarthmore College and received an M.B.A. from New York University. Her father was a professor emeritus and the chairman of the art department at the City University of New York.

Mr. Must is an architect at Anshen & Allen, an architectural firm in San Francisco. He graduated from Yale University, from which he also received a master's degree in architecture. His mother, who is retired, taught prekindergarden at the Residence Park School in Dayton. His father is a printmaker and a professor emeritus of art and art history at Wright State University in Dayton.
